attributes.action: Remove At Least Two Forms of Tax From Motorists
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I petition you to remove two taxes from motorists by removing two of the following:

All tolls from roads and bridges in the UK.

Vehicle duty.

Fuel tax. 

It's not acceptable to tax motorists with all three.

When the first Severn Crossing was built, we were reassured that the tolls would be scrapped eventually, they never were.

The Second Severn Crossing costs more than five times to cross, than the cost of crossing of The Forth Bridge, which was £1, only payable in one direction in 2007.

On another petition response the Government has justified the high cost due to it's only being applied in one direction. 

It's not justifiable when you compare it to the Forth Bridge.

It is not justifiable to be taxed numerous times on our vehicles.
